page.title: 03Brusher Mills
page.content: {Brusher Mills}was born on March 19th 1838.Sadly he died at the age of 67 on July 1st 1905.Brusher was described,in the New Forest as one of the chief personalities,his real name was{Henry {Mills.}He acquired the nickname of{ {Brusher'}because he used to brush clean the wickets of the local cricket grounds.But a more probable story is that it was given to him one hard,cold winter when daily brushed the ice for skaters on the lake in Foxlease park but his main occupation was snake catching.A habitat favoured by Brusher was the Railway Inn at Brockenhurst and was recently renamed {The Snake {Catcher}in his memory.The summer of 1884 was the year when Brusher took to sleeping in a disused charcoal burners hut.He lived there for 19 years and 4 months but the hut was burnt in 1903.
